alert.note: Alert for Durham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 30 at 11:19PM EDT until July 01 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SATURDAY FOR SOUTHERN DURHAM COUNTY... At 1119 PM EDT, While the heavy rain has exited the area, ongoing flooding and high water will continue to pose a risk over the next few hours. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Durham, Chapel Hill, Bethesda, Parkwood, Research Triangle, Eno River State Park, Rollingview Marina, Falls Lake and Jordan Lake. Minor Flooding is also possible along Third Fork Creek Trail. Water may approach the parking lot of the Durham Department of Public Works. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
